document_data.mainbody:
'''''The Diamond''''' by [[J. Robert King]] and [[Ed Greenwood]] is the ninth and final novella in the [[Double Diamond Triangle Saga]] series.

{{quote|''An epic quest is over... or ist it? Piergeiron, Open Lord of Waterdeep, is dead ... or is he? The search for the abductors of his bride Eidola has finally drawn to a close ... or has it? As the paladins and mercenaries gather in Waterdeep for a solemn ceremony, the last act of this epic adventure is played out against a background of treachery and deceit. And the last surprise will be the greatest of all. "The Diamond" brings to an end the nine-book serial novel published by TSR and set in the exciting world of the "Forgotten Realms." Be sure to look for the other parts in your local bookstore.''}}
document_data.Summary: Piergieron is in a coma due to the death of Eidola and thought to be dead. His funeral is interrupted by the return of Kern and Noph, with Trandon and Entreri prisoner. The Blackstaff frees them both while faking their deaths. In the second funeral, Piergieron regains consciousness and is rescued. Miltiades, Belgin, Rings, and Aleena return with Eidola’s soul gem and release her soul from it. At the third funeral, intended to preserve her reputation, the gem releases the soul of Shaleen, Piergieron’s first wife and the basis for Eidola's human form. They are joyfully wed and Noph becomes a Masked Lord of Waterdeep.
